Sentencas: The counter transport of gases with different molecular weights is experimentally and numerically investigated to clarify gas transport phenomena of a hydrogen-steam binary mixture in a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode during operation.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The crossover fluxes through the anodes with different porous microstructures are measured and the effect of total pressure difference on the counter gas transport is evaluated.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Without the total pressure difference, an imbalance is found in the diffusion fluxes of gases with different molecular weights in accordance with Graham's diffusion law.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Therefore, for the equimolar transport, a total pressure difference is required to enhance the transport of the gas with a larger molecular weight.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: A numerical model based on the cylindrical pore interpolation model (CPIM) is developed and confirmed to be able to reproduce the experimental results accurately.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: In addition, the limiting current density of an SOFC predicted using the model we developed agrees with that of the cell evaluated in the experiment.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The total pressure at the anode-electrolyte interface is found to be about 20 kPa higher than that on the anode surface at 1 A cm-2, which is non-negligible.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Therefore, we must take this into account when we perform numerical simulation of anode-supported SOFCs.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure difference on counter transport of gases with different molecular weights through solid oxide fuel cell anode
